title: The Intelligence - “The public just haven't grasped what happens when hospitals get too full”—covid-19 in America
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: Venezuela’s election will only cement its dictator’s grip and an obituary for the Arecibo telescope“The public just haven't grasped what happens when hospitals get too full”—covid-19 in AmericaNUMBERS OF CASES, hospitalisations and deaths are rocketing across the country.
We examine the situation in the Midwest, as a microcosm of a wider unfolding tragedy.
Venezuela’s ruling party will take over the National Assembly after Sunday’s vote, sidelining the self-proclaimed legitimate leader Juan Guaidó and cementing Nicolás Maduro’s dictatorship.
And the fruitful life and ignominious death of the Arecibo telescope.
Runtime: 23minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneInFor full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: Venezuela’s election will only cement its dictator’s grip and an obituary for the Arecibo telescope
“The public just haven't grasped what happens when hospitals get too full”—covid-19 in America

NUMBERS OF CASES, hospitalisations and deaths are rocketing across the country. We examine the situation in the Midwest, as a microcosm of a wider unfolding tragedy. Venezuela’s ruling party will take over the National Assembly after Sunday’s vote, sidelining the self-proclaimed legitimate leader Juan Guaidó and cementing Nicolás Maduro’s dictatorship. And the fruitful life and ignominious death of the Arecibo telescope. Runtime: 23min
